definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage

sentences.english: Therefore, the reasoning goes, only you can be the judge of the quality of an orgasm.
sentences.chinese: 因此可以推知，只有你才能判斷你自己高潮的質量。

sentences.english: The childhood shows the man,as morning shows the day.
sentences.chinese: 從童年可看成年，猶如從早晨可推知一天。

sentences.english: The judge inferred a motive from an effect.
sentences.chinese: 法官從結果中推知動機。

sentences.english: It can be deduced that the flowers blossoming later will be richer than those in previous years.
sentences.chinese: 他日花開，可以推知將比往年的盛大。

sentences.english: We can infer from Dr. Myers and Dr. Worm's paper that.
sentences.chinese: 從邁爾斯博士和沃爾姆博士的論文中我們可以推知。

definition: to infer/to consider and come to a judgment/to recommend/to estimate/deduced to be
to study/to examine/to probe/to study the underlying principles
lit. to glimpse just one spot (of the panther) (idiom)/fig. to get an inkling of the whole picture
to make a definitive judgment/to come to a firm conclusion
to examine/to investigate/to try to determine
